title: WisgateOS Backup and Restore Guide > WisgateOS Backup / Restore > Backup and Restore System Configuration [wisgateos]
content: In this section, you can create a backup for the current setup or use one to restore the settings to a previous setup. By clicking on the **Generate archive** button, an archive will be downloaded on your PC. This is the backup file; it can be used for restoring your setup to the current settings at any time. Inside the archive, there are subfolders where you can find a variety of config files for the system like for example config, lorasrv, mosquitto, opkg.conf, and others.
parent_content: In this section, you can create a backup for the current setup or use one to restore the settings to a previous setup. By clicking on the **Generate archive** button, an archive will be downloaded on your PC. This is the backup file; it can be used for restoring your setup to the current settings at any time. Inside the archive, there are subfolders where you can find a variety of config files for the system like for example config, lorasrv, mosquitto, opkg.conf, and others.

title: WisgateOS Backup and Restore Guide > WisgateOS Backup / Restore > Perform Reset > Reset Settings to Default Values [CONFIRMATION]
content:
The **Perform reset** button will reset all settings and customizations to their default values. A confirmation pop-up will appear. Selecting **Ok** will start the process.  
> **Image:** Perform Reset Confirmation
parent_content:
The **Perform reset** button will reset all settings and customizations to their default values. A confirmation pop-up will appear. Selecting **Ok** will start the process.  
> **Image:** Perform Reset Confirmation

title: WisgateOS Backup and Restore Guide > WisgateOS Backup / Restore > Restore Backup > Restore Gateway Settings from Backup Archive
content:
From the **Restore backup** utility, you can use a backup archive to upload and restore previous settings to the gateway. Press the **Choose File** button, then select your archive and click **Upload archive…**. A progress window will appear and when the process is done the user will be able to log in again into the gateway’s Web UI.  
> **Image:** Restoring a Backup Process
parent_content:
From the **Restore backup** utility, you can use a backup archive to upload and restore previous settings to the gateway. Press the **Choose File** button, then select your archive and click **Upload archive…**. A progress window will appear and when the process is done the user will be able to log in again into the gateway’s Web UI.  
> **Image:** Restoring a Backup Process

title: WisgateOS Backup and Restore Guide > WisgateOS Backup / Restore > Flash new firmware image > Flashing New Firmware Images to the Gateway
content:
This section contains only one tool that allows you to flash new firmware images to the gateway. The **Keep settings** option will keep the settings of the gateway as they are at that moment. If not active, the default firmware settings will be used.  
> **TIP:** NOTE
When this option is off, all of your data kept on the gateway will be lost during the flashing. All settings will be set to their default values.
parent_content:
This section contains only one tool that allows you to flash new firmware images to the gateway. The **Keep settings** option will keep the settings of the gateway as they are at that moment. If not active, the default firmware settings will be used.  
> **TIP:** NOTE
When this option is off, all of your data kept on the gateway will be lost during the flashing. All settings will be set to their default values.  
To use this utility, click on the **Choose File** button and then click **Flash firmware**. After this, you will see a Checksum, as well as the size of the file, and a message if the configuration will be kept or not. If you are sure that you want to flash the file, select **Proceed**.  
Once the process is complete, you can now log in to the Web UI again.  
> **Image:** Firmware Flashing Information  
> **Image:** Flashing Firmware Process
